name: Introduction to Media Studies
description: This course introduces students to the study of media. Students will learn about the various forms of media, such as print, film, television, and digital media, and how they shape our understanding of the world around us.

name: Visual Culture
description: This course explores the visual aspect of media and popular culture. Students will analyze and interpret images, such as photographs and films, and their relationship to social, cultural, and political contexts.

name: Writing for the Media
description: This course teaches students how to write for different forms of media, including journalism, public relations, and advertising. Students will learn how to use different writing styles and techniques to craft effective messages for different audiences.

name: Media Ethics and Law
description: This course explores legal and ethical issues related to media and communication. Students will analyze the impact of laws and regulations on media production and consumption, as well as the role of media in shaping public opinion and policy.

name: Media and Society
description: This course examines the relationship between media and society, focusing on how media affects social, cultural, and political norms. Students will analyze various media forms in relation to social phenomena, such as gender, race, and class.

name: Media History
description: This course examines the historical development of media and its impact on society. Students will analyze the changing technologies, institutions, and social practices associated with media production and consumption.

name: Media Theory and Criticism
description: This course introduces students to different theoretical approaches to the study of media, such as political economy, cultural studies, and postmodernism. Students will also learn how to apply various critical approaches to analyze media texts.

name: Media Production
description: This course teaches students how to produce media content for different platforms, such as film, television, and digital media. Students will learn how to use different tools and techniques to produce effective media content.
